title: SC and disputes between Congress and President

content.prompt: Which of the following statements best describes the Supreme Court’s actions with respect to disputes between Congress and the President?

choices.label: The Court has steadily favored the expansion of presidential power at the expense of Congress.
The Court has refused to allow Congress to subpoena officials from the executive branch.
The Court generally has tried to avoid deciding conflicts between Congress and the President.
The Court has supported congressional limits on the President’s powers as commander-in-chief.
The Court has supported congressional use of the legislative veto as a means of controlling the President.

skill.text: Skill 1.A: Describe political principles, institutions, processes, policies, and behaviors.
